member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.File.CloudFile
member.summary: Represents a file in the Microsoft Azure File service.
Represents a Microsoft Azure File.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.File.CloudFile.OpenRead(Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition,Microsoft.Azure.Storage.File.FileRequestOptions,Microsoft.Azure.Storage.OperationContext)
member.summary: Opens a stream for reading from the file.
member.param: An object that represents the access conditions for the file. If null, no condition is used.
A object that specifies additional options for the request.
An object that represents the context for the current operation.
member.returns: A stream to be used for reading from the file.
member.remarks: On the object returned by this method, the method must be called exactly once for every call. Failing to end a read process before beginning another read can cause unknown behavior.

member.param: The callback delegate that will receive notification when the asynchronous operation completes.
A user-defined object that will be passed to the callback delegate.
member.returns: An that references the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.File.CloudFile.OpenWrite(System.Nullable{System.Int64},Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition,Microsoft.Azure.Storage.File.FileRequestOptions,Microsoft.Azure.Storage.OperationContext)
member.summary: Opens a stream for writing to the file. If the file already exists, then existing data in the file may be overwritten.
member.param: The size of the file to create, in bytes, or null. If null, the file must already exist. If not null, a new file of the given size will be created. If size is not null but the file already exists on the service, the already-existing file will be deleted.
An object that represents the access conditions for the file. If null, no condition is used.
A object that specifies additional options for the request.
An object that represents the context for the current operation.
member.returns: A object to be used for writing to the file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.File.CloudFile.StartCopy(System.Uri,Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition,Microsoft.Azure.Storage.AccessCondition,Microsoft.Azure.Storage.File.FileRequestOptions,Microsoft.Azure.Storage.OperationContext)
member.summary: Begins an operation to start copying another Azure file or blob's contents, properties, and metadata to this Azure file.
member.param: The of the source blob or file.
An object that represents the access conditions for the source object. If null, no condition is used.
An object that represents the access conditions for the destination file. If null, no condition is used.
A object that specifies additional options for the request. If null, default options are applied to the request.
An object that represents the context for the current operation.
member.returns: The copy ID associated with the copy operation.
member.remarks: This method fetches the file's ETag, last-modified time, and part of the copy state. The copy ID and copy status fields are fetched, and the rest of the copy state is cleared.

member.summary: The file is a system file. That is, the file is part of the operating system or is used exclusively by the operating system.

member.summary: The file is a standard file that has no special attributes. This attribute is valid only if it is used alone.

member.summary: The file is a directory.

member.summary: The file is a candidate for backup or removal.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.File.CloudFileNtfsAttributes.Temporary
member.summary: The file is temporary. A temporary file contains data that is needed while an application is executing but is not needed after the application is finished. File systems try to keep all the data in memory for quicker access rather than flushing the data back to mass storage. A temporary file should be deleted by the application as soon as it is no longer needed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.File.CloudFileNtfsAttributes.Offline
member.summary: The file is offline. The data of the file is not immediately available.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.File.CloudFileNtfsAttributes.NotContentIndexed
member.summary: The file will not be indexed by the operating system's content indexing service.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Storage.File.CloudFileNtfsAttributes.NoScrubData
member.summary: The file or directory is excluded from the data integrity scan. When this value is applied to a directory, by default, all new files and subdirectories within that directory are excluded from data integrity.
